pr_title: [modbus] BaseModbusThingHandler: Add ability to retrieve slave address

timeline.message:
[modbus] BaseModbusThingHandler: Add ability to retrieve slave address

Signed-off-by: Fabian Wolter <github@fabian-wolter.de>

timeline.bodyText:
Hmm this will now raise unchecked exception when bridge is offline e.g due to configuration error? When bridge is having configuration error, the slave id is not available.
Perhaps the configuration error of bridge is the only situation when these methods can fail?
Should it set thing to offline with BRIDGE_OFFLINE instead of raising unchecked exception to framework?
timeline.author: ssalonen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -59,9 +58,27 @@ public BaseModbusThingHandler(Thing thing) {
     public void initialize() {

replies.bodyText: I see no other chance to prevent the Thing from being initialized. Setting the Thing status has no effect as it will be overwritten by any updateStatus() in initialize() of the "user" class. Do you have a suggestion?
replies.author: fwolter

replies.bodyText:
Good point...
I looked at some examples from the code base

AbstractModbusEndpointThingHandler parent class sets thing OFFLINE. initialize not implemented in child class
BeaconBluetoothHandler (in bluetooth) parent class sets thing OFFLINE. Child class (RuuviTagHandler) has check

        if (getThing().getStatus() != ThingStatus.OFFLINE) {
            heartbeatFuture = scheduler.scheduleWithFixedDelay(this::heartbeat, 0, HEARTBEAT_TIMEOUT_MINUTES,
                    TimeUnit.MINUTES);

I there might be race condition here... Ist getThing().getStatus() update instantaneous?

IT100BridgeHandler extends DSCAlarmBaseBridgeHandler super initialize is called conditionally when config is otherwise OK.

Do we typically expect to override the initialize method in child class?
replies.author: ssalonen

replies.bodyText:
It's always good to have a second pair of eyes. The examples inspired me to come up with a slightly other solution.
The BaseModbusThingHandler got a new abstract method modbusInitialize(), which is only called, when the Modbus Bridge is configured correctly. That way the Thing can be set to offline in a normal way. Also, the user doesn't need to call super.initialize() anymore, which was error-prone. So, the boolean flag could be dropped, too. I made the initialize() method final to prevent the user from overriding it wrongly.
replies.author: fwolter

timeline.bodyText: Consider renaming the method as it no longer returns endpoint
timeline.author: ssalonen

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this is true?
timeline.author: ssalonen

timeline.bodyText:
BRIDGE_OFFLINE would be more correct for cases when bridge is offline? It would direct the user to look at the bridge error message.
Are there any other reasons we expect the initialization to fail?
timeline.author: ssalonen

replies.bodyText: I saw there's a ThingStatusDetail.BRIDGE_UNINITIALIZED. I think that would fit even better. I moved the invocation of the abstract method out of the try-block, that only a Bridge error could lead to a BRIDGE_UNINITIALIZED.
replies.author: fwolter

timeline.bodyText:
According to javadoc, null communication interface is returned when initialization is incomplete == bridge is not online.
By failing fast (check bridge status) we can offer better error message to user?
timeline.author: ssalonen

replies.bodyText: I reworked all error messages to achieve easier debugging for the user.
